p: For centuries, Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM) has attracted extensive attention for its ability to treat and alleviate a wide range of chronic diseases. Furthermore, TCM has significant advantages in treating various gynecological disorders including endometriosis [ 22]. Considering the complex pathogenesis of this dysfunction and the limited effects of the conventional treatments, Chinese medicines were used to treat the endometriotic lesions and to control endometriosis-related symptoms such as pelvic pain, dysmenorrhea, and abnormal uterine bleeding [ 20]. Considering the complexity of TCM, the differences in clinical experience and the lack of clinical studies, a depth research of the mechanisms of action of the herbs is required [ 23].
